Key Details

Title
Rest during Prairie Plowing
Medium
Cast Stone Relief
Date
1940
Location
Fowler (U.S. Post Office)
Labor Rights
Historical Figure

Nat Werner

About the Artist

Nat Werner was a sculptor known for his socially conscious work. His WPA commission in Fowler reflects the agricultural backbone of the local economy.

The Work

A relief sculpture that humanizes the agricultural laborer, depicting a moment of rest. It acknowledges the exhaustion and humanity of the worker behind the agricultural production.

Research this Artist

Built for the community. Documenting art and activism across Indiana.
